intro: Eucosia hengchunensis, commonly known as the Hengchun eucosia, is a species of flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountainous regions. Its leaves are ovate with a slightly hairy surface, and it produces a distinctive, soft latex when damaged. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
